title: The Cryptovator
author: The Cryptovator
content: Saudi Telecom is the biggest Telecom company in Saudi Arabia. They are operating the business in many countries as well and Bahrain is one of them. Recently Saudi Telecom (STC) in Bahrain accept crypto payment. Just saw it on Binance tweets. To be honest I know Saudi Telecom very well and feel proud that they are accepting crypto payments now. It's just like opening the door. If more Telecom companies start accepting crypto payment then it would be a nice adaption. However, at least a small positive news behind many incidents.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Well, this is, of course, good. Saudi Telecom is a big and influential player in the country. It plays a big role in the day-to-day lives of Saudis. However, it seems there are too many players in the middle. There's Binance Pay. There's Eazy Pay. There will certainly be banks as well because, for sure, the company won't probably be receiving the payments in Bitcoin itself. But, yeah, this is still adoption. Anyway, I wonder why, except for Binance's tweet, I haven't encountered this in the news.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: We certainly need some good news in the face of the FTX collapse contagion. I am not so familiar with Saudi Telecom since I am not based in the Middle East but am assuming that this is a big business organization with lost of revenues and is now looking its good share in the booming (especially in this region) cryptocurrency market. As what I am saying in the past, I am hoping those accepting crypto to plan a marketing campaign by including incentives for people to be using crypto so they can go into the hassles of entering the crypto option and using it to pay. No incentives can be a dry thing especially for people who are speculators.

comments.body: I don't understand Arabic but with Google translate, I did not find any term on Know Your Customer at STC's Terms and ConditionsIf it is truly their Terms and policies, no KYC for their customers, it is good for normal users and for cryptocurrency users who want to use cryptocurrency to pay bills and other payment on STC.Could anybody from Arabic countries can confirm STC policies on KYC, please?Google Translate is not too good.

The de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud is really globalizing and revolutionizing the economy of Saudi Arabia. The Gulf region use to be a closed society that always repel innovation and change. But this young ruler has been a trailblazer in the course of opening the region to innovation and modern technological advancement. That's why it is good to have young and visionary leaders and not old and backward political leaders.Saudi Telecom's acceptance of bitcoin is good news. Saudi is a major player in the Gulf economy and this development might influence other nations in that region to take the same step. This bold step might even attract more crypto investors to Saudi Arabia.

comments.body: Quote from: tbct_mt2 on December 15, 2022, 05:29:51 AMI don't understand Arabic but with Google translate, I did not find any term on Know Your Customer at STC's Terms and ConditionsIf it is truly their Terms and policies, no KYC for their customers, it is good for normal users and for cryptocurrency users who want to use cryptocurrency to pay bills and other payment on STC.Could anybody from Arabic countries can confirm STC policies on KYC, please?The link that you used is the link to the official website of the company in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. This is the link to the company's website in the Bahrain branch:https://www.stc.com.bh/arI checked the site and there are no indications of this news, and only users in Bahrain can confirm that the service is actually working.I am surprised that this news is not the subject of media attention, even in Arab forums and groups. I was also surprised that the service was launched in Bahrain, which is a small island with a limited population, although the company has branches in other countries .

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: They accept payment through third party apps so we can't say it's a real adoption.STC have a service called STC Pay, which enables you to pay using their application for some services, which I thought was the one that accepted payment in bitcoins, but what is happening now is that you transfer money from your account in Binance to the company's bank account, which you transfer to STC's bank account .
